meanings.definition: An image or copy that is derived from an original.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed an ectype of the famous painting.
meanings.sent2: She made an ectype of the document for her records.
meanings.sent3: The ectype of the painting looked so real, it fooled everyone!
meanings.sent4: His drawing was an ectype of perfection, capturing every detail flawlessly.
meanings.sent5: The ectype of the book cover was so vivid, it drew everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: To reproduce or copy an image or text.
meanings.sent1: They decided to ectype the ancient manuscript for preservation.
meanings.sent2: He ectypeed the photograph to share with his friends.
meanings.sent3: She ectypeed the recipe from the cookbook to try it out.
meanings.sent4: The artist ectypeed the famous painting with incredible precision.
meanings.sent5: The machine was able to ectype the design with amazing accuracy.
